page.title: 19Churches In Frenchay
page.content: Frenchay has an abundance of thriving Churches. The C of E Parish Church is, unusually, a relative newcomer, consecrated in 1834. Prior to this Frenchay was dominated by non-conformity with both a Quaker Meeting House and a Unitarian Chapel being constructed in the 17th century. Both these Chapels have well attended services today and are used in addition for exhibitions, concerts and meetings. St John Baptist the C of E Church has congregations of over 100 at Morning Services and also runs a Sunday School, and groups for prayer, study, women and parents as well as a music and drama guild and an orchestra. There is also a Roman Catholic Church, a Hospital Chapel and a private Chapel in a Children's home.
